text:
<@U2E6FUEEP> Yep, you can: <http://prntscr.com/iekpgl>

If it's just a simple "not equal to" you could use the regex `^(?!foobar).*$` which says "does not start with foobar" (note: case sensitive). Anyway, would be much more convenient to just have a dropdown option for it!
Thanks so much for that! I’ll use it until we can get a dropdown. :simple_smile:

When using the "tag" module in the new design manager custom modules, the module preview only shows the topics id number (which isnt in the JSON Dev Info) and not the actual name of the tag. Then when it loads in a template it shows the topic slug but you cant get the actual label value. I mean you can use the `replace()` filter but if you have a value name like `one-time deals` you'd be stripping that `-` out as well.  

Is there a way to get the label added to the JSON info that is spit out with the Tag Module.
Any chance you can shoot me an example?
